dt: {bc}to mark by some ceremony or observation {bc}{sx|observe||}

pt: {sc}keep{/sc} {sc}observe{/sc} {sc}celebrate{/sc} {sc}commemorate{/sc} mean to notice or honor a day, occasion, or deed. {sc}keep{/sc} stresses the idea of not neglecting or violating.

pt.t: {it}kept{/it} the Sabbath by refraining from work

pt: {sc}observe{/sc} suggests marking the occasion by ceremonious performance.
{sc}celebrate{/sc} suggests acknowledging an occasion by festivity.

pt.t: traditionally {it}celebrates{/it} Thanksgiving with a huge dinner

pt: {sc}commemorate{/sc} suggests that an occasion is marked by observances that remind one of the origin and significance of the event.

pt.t: {it}commemorate{/it} Memorial Day with the laying of wreaths

et: Latin {it}commemoratus{/it}, past participle of {it}commemorare{/it}, from {it}com-{/it} + {it}memorare{/it} to remind of, from {it}memor{/it} mindful {ma}{mat|memory|}{/ma}
shortdef: to mark by some ceremony or observation : observe
to serve as a memorial of
